intro: Rothmannia manganjae, commonly known as the Manganja rothmannia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Rothmannia manganjae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
